page.title: 08TOURISM IN RAMSBOTTOM
page.content: "The impressive Peel Tower overlooks the small town nestling at the foot of Holcombe Hill.Neat rows of terraced stone cottages line the valley sides,the river Irwell meanders its way south.This is Ramsbottom where community life centres around the cobbled market place and sheep lazily graze the upland pasture". At present steps are being taken to develop Ramsbottom for tourists-the {historic monument-Peel Tower}is being renovated,footpaths are being reinforced and signposted,the hill-sides are being transformed by the planting of trees and shrubs and it is hoped to re-open the old railway-line and run a{steam-train } through Ramsbottom from Bury to Rawtenstall.There is also a Sunday market once a month.Improved{transport in the area should help{tourism.
